title: Charli XCX’s New Album Has Finally Descended From the Heavens
text:
Photo: Paul Kane/Getty Images

Charli by Charli XCX may be self-titled, but the album itself, out today, isn’t just about her. Charli XCX has brought together some of the biggest names in pop, and some names you should get to know ASAP. The British singer’s third album, Charli, has 13 collaborators, including all three Haim sisters. Troye Sivan appears on two songs. Yaeji, Clairo, Big Freedia, Cupcakke, Brooke Candy, Pabllo Vittar, Lizzo, Sky Ferreira, Kim Petras, and Tommy Cash round out the (utterly fabulous) group. Because she’s a generous queen, 7 out of 15 songs on the album were released in the lead-up, including “1999” and “2099” (both featuring Troye Sivan), “Gone” by Christine and the Queens, and “Blame It On Your Love” with Lizzo. Find out what else Charli has in store below.
description: Pop star Charli XCX’s third album, ‘Charli’ is officially out, featuring Troyer Sivan, Haim, and more.
